title.value: Rare CNVs and phenome-wide profiling highlight brain-structural divergence and phenotypical convergence
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as provided.
title.quote: Rare CNVs and phenome-wide profiling highlight brain-structural divergence and phenotypical convergence

extractions.description: The paper investigates how rare Copy Number Variants (CNVs) influence brain structure and phenotypic profiles. It employs tools from machine learning to explore associations between brain organization and behavioral differentiation across eight key CNVs, using both a clinical cohort and data from the UK Biobank.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results and data analysis to study the associations between CNVs and brain/behavioral phenotypes.
type.quote: Here, we quantitatively dissect the associations between brain organization and behavioral differentiation across eight key CNVs.

name.justification: The primary focus of the study is on understanding how genetic variations, particularly CNVs, affect brain structure and function.
name.quote: A chief goal of modern neuroscience is understanding how genetic variation impacts brain organization and inter-individual differences in behavior.

name.justification: The study explores the genetic foundations of CNVs and how they influence brain morphology and behavior.
name.quote: This class of genetic mutations opens a unique window into the investigation of how neurogenetic determinants shape human behavior, cognition, and development.

name.justification: Machine learning techniques such as linear discriminant analysis (LDA) were used to develop predictive models linking CNVs with brain structure and phenotypic data.
name.quote: As a first step, we leveraged tools from machine learning, including linear discriminant analysis (LDA), to isolate CNV-specific brain morphology signatures from a multisite clinical cohort.

name.justification: UK Biobank was used extensively in this study to explore phenotypic profiles associated with CNV carriers.
name.quote: The recent advent of population cohorts with rich phenotypic assessment batteries represents an untapped opportunity to conjointly examine a set of CNVs and characterize them at an unprecedented scale. In the present study, we interrogated the largest existing biomedical data resource, the UK Biobank.

referenced_paper_title.value: Medical consequences of pathogenic CNVs in adults: analysis of the UK Biobank
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper focuses on analyzing the medical consequences of CNVs using data from the UK Biobank.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Crawford, K. et al. Medical consequences of pathogenic CNVs in adults: analysis of the UK Biobank. J. Med. Genet. 56, 131â€“138 (2019).
